reviewText: If you can chew gum while you skate or merelylike to see Scandinavians be defeated inpseudo-Olympic competions that no longer existthen you will love D2: The Might Ducks.After a year of rest and working at Mall ofAmerica, half of the Ducks come back to joinforces with a Magic School Bus-like cross-sectionof interracial of hockey players and regionalstereotypes.But even 28 year old Dean Portman and a large-earedcowboy may not be enough to stop Team Iceland who,basically, is allowed to cheat.Even after picking up a black kid from inner cityLos Angeles, can a pre-pubescent racial melange possiblydefeat a eugenically perfected gene pool of aryangiants?You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll never mock skatesharpening again!So grab some of Han's egg meal and D2 today.
Title: D2 - The Mighty Ducks VHS

reviewText: 'D2: The Mighty Ducks' released in '94 is the second installment in the adventures of Coach Gordon Bombay (Emilio Estevez) and his misfit team of teenage hockey overachievers. After his shot at a professional hockey career is ended by a knee injury Gordon returns to the Mighty Ducks with a new vision of hockey glory. They have been chosen to join Team U.S.A. at the Junior Goodwill Games to be played at the Arrowhead Pond in California. Isn't Disney so predictable. Several outstanding Junior players from across the country are added to the team which adds some uncomfortable situations with the rest of the Ducks, but eventually they unite take on the hockey world like only the Mighty Ducks could.Emilio Estevez does an admirable job reprising the role of Gordon Bombay and Carsten Norgaard is a terrific bad guy as the unethical Coach Wolf Stansson of Team Iceland.`D2' has numerous funny moments and the cast is so energetic and enthusiastic you tend to overlook a lot of the obvious faults and inconsistencies in the plot. Little kids will love it, but older teens and adults probably won't make it to the end. Too many silly antics for my taste.
Title: D2 - The Mighty Ducks VHS

reviewText: The Mighty Ducks was a great movie put out by Disney, and this, the sequel, is no exception.  D2 picks up a year after their initial season.  In this movie, The Ducks are chosen to represent the USA at the Junior Goodwill Games.  In been selected, the team must face off against the best that the world has to offer, and at the same time show the world what they have to offer.  In the process of the tournament the Ducks face many challenges that need to be overcome and actually learn what it takes to be a team; all thanks to some "school-yard puck" masters.  Typical Duck hyjinks are present throughout the flick, and it was nice to see a lot of the original cast again, from Coach Bombay to Charlie, and of course Goldberg.  This movie is a nice family feature that a person of any age would enjoy.  If you love hockey, this movie is a great watch, and if you're up for a great watch, this movie is for you.  Just remember to watch out for "The Flying V."
Title: D2 - The Mighty Ducks VHS

reviewText: This is the best Mighty Ducks movie!  Unlike what most people say, this is not a repeat of the first, it is totaly different!  And you just gotta love that knuckle-puck!
summary: The best one to skate up on the ice!
Title: D2 - The Mighty Ducks VHS

reviewText: D2..The Mighty Ducks are back is the best movie ever. Emilio Estevez gives a performance that is Oscar worthy. His portrayal of the determined Gordon Bombay is nothing short of breath-taking. Emilio completely becomes Gordon Bombay in his most convincing role to date. Aside from Emilio, a young Joshua Jackon (aka Pacey from Dawson's Creek) shows glimpses of superstardom in his role as the young, caring Charlie Conway. When Charlie is willing to give up his role on the Ducks for the teams good, you WILL Have goosebumps. There is a little bit of Charlie Conway in each and every one of us. This movie also has loads of comedy. First off- The opening scene when they rollerblade through the Mall of America is..in a word..hilarious. Also- A young Kenan (of Nickelodeon fame) introduces the Knuckle Puck in this movie! The action and the laughs never stop in this movie which in a nutshell defined the 1990's and set the standard for all movies.
Title: D2 - The Mighty Ducks VHS

reviewText: In this the second installment of the ducks story Coach Emilio Estevez returns to town from his stint in minor league hockey with a hurt leg.  He is asked to coach the United States Junior Team at the Goodwill Games in Los Angles.  His old team is reassembled and they trek to L.A. where they encounter a cast of carictures which includes line dancing on the ice, uye ha!After losing a game to the new Evil Empire (Iceland) they aspire to get back to basics and are taken to task by a street-tuff roller hockey team featuring a young and mouthy Keenan Thompson.When the team changes into NHL jerseys can victory be far away?  Wayne Gretzky appears briefly as himself as product placement rules the day.  With all the pads and helmets it is an effort to show the actors. good skate shots.  Feels likeThe Bad News Bears in Breaking Training.
Title: D2 - The Mighty Ducks VHS

reviewText: this movie rules cause it reminds me of my fun childhood where i did nothing but eat mcdonalds and watch disney movies like this. i like when they goto LA and they meet the new crew of badass 14 year old hockey players. and that one kid gets a friend and mr. bigglesworth ahhaha calls them the smash brothers. the icelands guys are scary but the assistant coach is hot. thats why gordon bombay AKA emilio estevez went to eat ice cream with her but the smash brothers saw him and they got mad. she was like greenland is full of ice and iceland is very nice. thats her line in the whole damn movie.i like the cowboy kid from texas who has the rope on a DAMN HOCKEY RINK for some reason. and he doesnt know how to say rodeo drive in beverly hills. and then golberg says he's tori spellings cousin so he goes into this expensive store and gets all the models to wear clothes for him cause he says its for his mother. but then he says how about bikinis and the lady throws them out.charlie is a downer in this movie. not like d1 where hes this cool kid, or liek in d3 where he meets the girl at his new school and hes like i love pizza and Slayer (yes the metal band) and i dont smoke. o my god thats so annoying give me more golberg scenes.best part though is when team USA plays the ghetto kid from good burger and kenan n kel. and the goals are trash cans and they play on top of a building. i had no idea ghetto LA had a street hockey scene. and they he shows them the knuckle puck and all the team USA kids are like 'no way man!' and then some team USA kid tells kenan's bro that kenan has a big mouth and he looks at him and hes like 'ya he does have a big mouth doesnt he'.this movie is a classic. i loved and still love every minute of it.

reviewText: Welcome to this, this is another review in my 20 years ago 2004 in film review series as you can see on the title this is 20 years ago D2 The Mighty Ducks a movie that I watched a s  h  it ton times as a kid in the mid 90's I hadn't saw the movie in 11 years until recently sat & watched it again. It's a movie that both kids & adults can watch & enjoy. I couldn't find the budget information on this movie I know it made $45 million at the boxoffice it was directed by Sam Weisman he has done a lot of TV work he did direct Dickie Roberts Former Child Star. Emilio Estevez as Coach Bombay, Joshua Jackson as Charlie Conway, Matt Doretry as Les Averman, Shaun Weiss as Goldberg, Vincent Larusso as Adam Banks & Elden Henson as Fulton Reed return as well as some new cast members Carsten Norgaard as Wolf "The Dentist" Stansson, Aaron Lorber as Dean Portman, Kennan Thompson as Russ Tyler, Ty O'Neal as Dwayne Robertson, Kathryn Erbe as Ms McKay, Michael Tucker as Mr Tibbles, Colombe Jackson as Julie Gaffney & Victor Luis as Mendoza. The story is Gordon Bombay is in this Minor League Hockey Team called The Waves some idiot from the opposing team during a game takes a Hockey Stick & takes his knees out just when he was getting close to NHL. For Bombay it's back to Blukville MN. He goes to Hans shop to work it's being ran by Han's Brother Jan cause he went to the old country for awhile so they could kill him off in D3. You have this man named Mr Tibbles who is from The Goodwill Games who wants him to be The Coach in The Junior Goodwill Games for Team USA. So Bombay goes out Roller Blading get The Ducks back together you also have 3 members from The Hawks return for for a little cameo but they're humiliated by a returning Fulton. Mr Tibbles makes a deal with Bombay with all this merchandising. You're introduced to some new characters like a Cowboy named Dwayne Robertson, Ken Wu a figure skater, Dean Portman a sort of metal head who becomes fast friends with Fulton. Luis Mendoza who is a fast skater he can't stop though & this girl named Julie who has helped her team win 3 State Championships in Maine. You're also introduced to Ms McKay who is a Tutor. They're are bits of humor that are better than the original but 1 thing they didn't carry over was Averman's humor cause he's not funny in this movie. There's humor like Fulton & some of the guys drive a Zamboni into rink like 4 years before Stone Cold Steve Austin did in The WWF. In the 1st game Team USA goes up against Trinidad & Tobago which is a fun game you also have the introduction of another new character named Russ Tyler & this kid is always yelling smart alec comments at Team USA somehow he always gets into the games. Fulton & Dean known together as The Bash Brothers go & knock all these players from Trinidad & Tobago down the important thing is that they help Team USA score a point. Anytime The Trinidad & Tobago Team makes a goal these guys start playing some kind calypso music. Team USA dominates the game & becomes unstoppable like The Hawks you have a lot of talk about The Iceland Team at this press conference The Iceland Team shows up Coached by Wolf "The Dentist" Stansson who I found to be a better villain than Coach Riley cause I didn't care for him but away from Hockey he might be an ok guy. Stansson on the other hand would probably kill you anywhere. I mean he seems evil but he does have charisma going for him he was in The NHL for only 1 year he did so much roughhousing & even punched his Coach so they put him over as a big bad heel. Bombay gets this house in Malibu that's really nice. The Team is in these Dorm's you have fun scenes with Goldberg, Mendoza & Ken playing this trick on Dwayne where they put Shaving Cream in his hand while he's asleep Goldberg takes this feather keeps brushing it across Dwayne's face & keep doing that until his face is covered in Shaving Cream. Dean & Fulton are head banging. Even now as an adult these kids don't annoy me. Bombay runs into The Trainer from The Iceland Team which she seems like the only likable person from The Iceland Team. Wolf stops her from chating with Bombay well cause he's sick in the head. Team USA in the meantime goes on to beat Italy during the game Goldberg asks a player from The Italian Team "Hey paisan meatballs slowing you down? Uh how do you say Italiano wussy. The rest of the team is going around the city Bombay is focusing more & more on fame than the team they suffer in the game against Iceland but the night before Dean & Fulton spot Bombay having Ice Cream with The Iceland Trainer. The next day before the game Dean & Fulton start droping hints Fulton asks "You have a good night last night Coach?" Bombay:"Yeah it was fine." Dean:"What'd you do?" Bombay:"Oh I just watched some TV got to bed early." Dean:"But not without a little desert right?" Fulton:"A little Ice Cream maybe?" The game against Iceland is brutal for Team USA Dean is thrown out of the game in the 1st 3 seconds he accidentally knocked a Referee down. You have Russ yell at Goldberg "Hey Goldberg I bet if that puck was a cheeseburger you'd stop it!" Dean is mad & is tearing up The Locker Room he busts up a bar stool with his bar hands. Everything Team USA tries against Iceland fails. Bombay replaces Goldberg with Julie before she can even start these 2 Iceland player start messing with her. She knocks them down & she's thrown out of the game. I will admit there's a wtf scene where Julie returns to The Locker Room Dean's mad hitting a pad Julie comes in she stops him she says "I know how you feel." That was a wtf part. After they suffer the embarrassing loss Wolf gives Bombay an arrogant Golf Clap. Mr Tibbles tells Bombay that they're 1 loss from being out of The Junior Goodwill Games & his sponser won't back a loser. Bombay chews the team out Fulton & Dean bring up that he was with The Iceland Trainer Dean says "Eating Ice Cream with the enemy huh Coach?" Bombay makes the team stay all night & practice the next day they can't preform in school which Ms McKay tells Bombay that the team can't make practice cause they're all too tired. The Russ Kid challenges Team USA to face his Older Brother & his friends & during this scene Whoomp There It Is by Tag Team is played which was a super super popular song in the mid 90's. During this Russ uses a move he calls The Knuckle Puck. This 1 boy teaches Ken when someone comes at him in a threatening manner you beat thes#  *  t out of them. Jan shows up at Bombay's house he tells him he needs to get back to why he loves the game. Another thing I will admit that some things feel like a rehash of the 1st movie they also use the trust issue between Bombay & the team again. Team USA goes up against Germany both teams are 1 loss away from elimination in The Junior Goodwill Games Bombay hasn't shown up yet so without a Coach they'll forfit. Charlie gets Ms McKay to stand in. You have Bombay come back & asks for their trust Team USA goes on to beat Germany. He goes back to focus on the team. Bombay finds out Banks has injured his wrist he has to bench him until he gets better while Russ is brought in & with the help of his Knuckle Puck they beat The Russian's. You also have a brief cameo by Wayne Gretzky there's a lot of cameo's by big time Pro Athletes who were big at the time which even though he doesn't play anymore Gretzky is still a big name. While they're practicing you have Wolf confront them Bombay & Wolf have words they play some 1 on 1 where Bombay gets the better of Wolf so Wolf goes & takes out Bombay's knee. That sets up the finals where Banks can go again Bombay tells them they have a full roster Charlie gives Banks his spot & becomes an Assistant Coach. It doesn't start off good for Team USA you have the star player for Iceland start something with Goldberg & he wants to fight him the team holds him back & tell him he would kill him. Goldberg says "Well at least hold me back like I'm going to kill him." Bombay sends Russ out he fails to pull off his Knuckle Puck. The star Iceland Player takes a Hockey Stick & hits Banks in his injured wrist area. Iceland breaks through The Ducks flying V even. You have Fulton & Dean go into Bash Brothers Mode clear house Ken gets a goal then he beat up that star player. That same star player not learning his lesson goes after Connie then you have Dwayne take a rope lassos that dude. Bombay then gets the team to refocus in The Locker Room Jan comes in with new Mighty Ducks Jersey's which these did look the best. You have The Ducks go on to beat Iceland. The teams shake hands & Bombay & Wolf do too. If they did that between Bombay & Riley in the 1st movie that would be fine Wolf felt more like a villain plus he took Bombay's knee out. The movie ends with the team around a camp fire singing We Are The Champions nothing wrong with that since Queen is up there with Areosmith as my favorite bands. D2 is a fun fast paced sequel that I like as much as the 1st the only problem are they rehash a few things from the 1st movie the soundtrack minus a few songs like this Let's Work Together by Dwight Yoakam didn't care for the song not 1 of his better songs it s  u  ck  e  d plus country didn't work for this movie even though their is redneck character I like. The score by JAC Redford is good. there's a couple of wtf scenes. Still I enjoy this movie along with the 1st both are great bookend movies. I don't know about D3 I haven't seen it since like 97 & I remember not liking it so I'll wait a couple of years to cover it for 20 years ago. Sam Weisman did a good job. Emillio Estevez was still really good. Joshua Jackson was good. Shaun Weiss was good. Elden Henson did a very good job I thought he was better in this movie than he was in the 1st. Matt Dorety was ok but when he tries to be funny this time around he fails. The newer cast of Kathryn Erbe is decent. Ty O'Neal was good. Justin Wong was ok. Aaron Lohr was really good. Colombe Jacobsen was good. Carsten Norgaard was very good. D2 for me was as good as 1st some thing weren't as good however some things were better or as good. I haven't even scratched the surface of how good this year was so if you're interested in my reviews of these movies from 20 years ago keep on reading.
summary: 20 years ago D2 The Mighty Ducks 9/10
Title: D2 - The Mighty Ducks VHS

reviewText: Released in 1994, D2 THE MIGHTY DUCKS is the first sequel to THE MIGHTY DUCKS. Continuing the story of the young Ice Hockey team and their coach Gordan Bombay (Emilio Estevez), we now have the team representing the USA at the Junior Goodwill Games as Team USA. Their main rivals this time round are the Iceland team. Along with the fun and mayhem that the Ducks cause during their time in Beverly Hills where the games are played, we have Gordon Bombay caught up in the success that he is currently having. You see, Team USA have a corporate sponsor who wants coach Bombay to do a lot of publicity, thus affecting his time with the Ducks. However by the end of the movie he learns that he needs to standby the Ducks in order for them to win and be Champions at the games.Initially we are reintroduced to some of the teenagers from the first movie. It is here that we discover who from the first film is not returning. Lucky for us we meet some new members of the team, and they are a lot more interesting than the ones who are missing. Of the newcomers, one is a goalie who can save virtually every shot made at her; another is extremely big and strong (but gets a little too carried away sometimes); another is a cowboy who uses a rope to round up players; one is a fantastic skater; and one is extremely fast, only problem is once he starts he has a real problem with stopping. All these new players greatly add to the fun of D2 THE MIGHTY DUCKS.As with many sports movies there is a lot of inspiration and this comes from the script, the dedicated acting and directing, and from the music which though repetitive is catchy and very awe-inspiring.All three of the Mighty Ducks movies are awe-inspiring and it just depends on your personal preference as to which one is the best. For me personally, my favorite is D3 THE MIGHTY DUCKS, but D2 THE MIGHTY DUCKS is a close second. As well as seeing Emilio Estevez, watch out for Joshua Jackson (Pre-Dawson's Creek) as the captain of the Mighty Ducks.There are no special features on this DVD, but the movie is in widescreen. However, the movie itself makes it worth buying so let's be thankful for small favors.
Title: D2 - The Mighty Ducks VHS

reviewText: I'm not the biggest fan of sequels, especially when it comes to kids movies as they generally go "off the rails".  I'm happy to announce that this is an exception to that awful trend.  While a number of kids didn't return for this second installment of the Mighty Ducks, I'm glad to see the ones I cared about hung in there.  Some cool new characters filled in the gap and they were obviously different at first but ultimately blended in nicely with the existing group...I credit Emilio Estevez because it seemed that as he was coaching the characters, he seemed to be coaching the young actors in the craft and it seemed to be working.  Kathryn Erbe is forever type-cast as Detective Alexandra Emes on Law and Order:  Criminal Intent in my book (I'm sure most people who view these films for the first time won't be in the L&O fanbase just yet) so this was a distracting factor for me, but she's a good actress so I'll let that slide.  Michael Tucker was wonderfully annoying as Team USA's sponser and I wonder if I was the only one who felt gleeful when he crashed  while learning how to skate.  I think ultimately there were two things I really didn't like about this film.  First, Ty O'Neal's character was "too southern" for my taste...I wonder how many people behave like he did in this film and play hockey.  I'm sure there are plenty of southern-born hockey players, but with his exaggerated mannerisms...I don't know.  Second, Joss Ackland was noticibly absent as Gordan's mentor and was replaced by Jan Rubes, who played his brother.  Rubes wasn't bad by any means, but I've become attached to the former...maybe having them both in the film together would have been great, but this arrangement we saw left a noticible emptiness for me.  On the other hand, there were plenty of new actors who made me very happy.  Elden Henson and Aaron Lohr will be the "Bash Brothers" forever in my heart and mind and Justin Wong's attempt to be as tough as them was pretty cool...they must have thought so too because they dubbed him their "Little Bash Brother".  Shaun Weiss was also fun to watch, though he can never top the scene from the first film where he has an exchange of words with Coach Bombay while taped to the goal.  Overall, this is a solid sequel and didn't go "sideways" as many sequels of kids movies sadly do.  If you enjoyed the first one, you will definetly enjoy this as well.
Title: D2 - The Mighty Ducks VHS

reviewText: I think D2: THE MIGHTY DUCKS is definitely the best film out of the whole series. I mean, the original and D3 were great, but this one is definitely #1! Bombay and the Ducks are back and this time, they have been asked to represent the USA hockey team for the Junior Winter/Summer Olympics held in L.A.! They also get some new teammates, as well, and they are all from different states in the country. At first, the Ducks and the new players can't seem to get along. But of course, soon they become fast friends.When they get to the Olympics, they face their biggest rival team - last year's championship team from Iceland. They are tough, bigger, faster, and much more competive, especially their coach. The USA team does very well in the beginning, but then they loose to the Iceland team bad. Soon, all Coach Bombay cares about is winning - and the USA team can't stand that! So when they take a day off, they meet up with these street hockey kids who teach them how to really play hockey and what it really takes to be a team. And their spirits suddenly start to grow, especially after Coach Bombay apologizes to them for acting like such a jerk. Finally, it is the championships and they have to face Iceland once again. Do they win? Why, of course!D2 is much more hilarious than the first, and the kids play more practical jokes and tricks. The hockey games are excellent, even though of course probably most of the hockey players you see on the ice are stunt doubles. Still, a great movie and a must see and a must have if you own and loved the first one! The Quack Attack is back and better than ever!
summary: THE BEST OF THE MIGHTY DUCKS!

reviewText: It happens very seldom that a sequel doesn't flop and disappear in comparison to its predecessor.D2, however is one of the few that hold strong with the original Mighty Ducks film.  Most of the young stars return in this film, and those who do not are replaced by much more interesting team members, including a bash brother and a hog-tying cowboy.Emilio Estevez returns as hockey coach Gordon Bombay who's returned to the Ducks after an injury in the minor leagues which has prevented a future in the NHL, although he is quickly back on his feet when he is asked to be the coach for the USA team in the Goodwill games. With the infusion of a few new players, some exciting new drills and a lot of hard work the ducks are back in action and ready to kick some Iceland butt!A little more silly then the first, but still packs in a lot of fun!
summary: Today it's Wheaties boxes. Tomorrow it's video games and action figures. The sky's the limit!

reviewText: The first "Mighty Ducks" movie captured the essence of "hockey humor".  With the addition of some new characters, "D2" manages to outshine even its quack-tacular predecessor.For a basic plot summary, this movie sees the Ducks reunite under Coach Gordon Bombay (Emilio Estevez) as Team USA for the Junior Olympics.  Besides the usual team leaders such as Charlie (Joshua Jackson) and Adam Banks (Vincent Larusso), newcomers like Julie "The Cat" Gaffney (Colombe Jacobsen), "Cowboy" Dewayne Robertson (Ty O'Neal), and Russ Tyler (Kenan Thompson), to name but a few, via for spots on the team.  The team to beat in the tournament is Iceland, coached by big, bad Wolf "The Dentist" Stansson (Carsten Norgaard), who completely intimidates all-comers."D2" is better than the original because of the crazy new characters that inject new life into the precedings.  The "old gang" is still as funny as ever, but every new character in this film is better than any of the originals (save maybe for Lester Averman (Matt Doherty)).This movie pretty much follows along with the same themes as the first one, those being the "sacred nature of hockey" and "having fun over winning".  For those who like sports movies or hockey in general, this one will have you laughing even louder than the first one.
summary: Addition Of New Characters Vaults This One Past The Original
Title: D2 - The Mighty Ducks VHS
